content.description: Â© Human Origins Program, Smithsonian Institution
content.question: Archaeological evidence from the site where the work was found has led scholars to suggest that the original audience lived in which of the following locations?

choices.label: In an ongoing settlement that included places with ritual significance
Near a series of caves containing wall paintings of constellations and maps
On an extensive group of islands that were linked by a network of canals
On a processional route to a royal burial complex

content.answer: In an ongoing settlement that included places with ritual significance

topic.text: 1.3: Theories and Interpretations of Prehistoric Art

skill.text: Skill 7.B: Explain how one or more art historically valid interpretations of a work of art (or group of related works of art) are derived from an analysis of its form, style, materials, content, function, context, reception, and/or meaning.
